summary: This is an email correspondence between legal parties in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) regarding the submission of an electronic devices application form. It involves prosecutors and defense attorneys coordinating procedural matters.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Recipient of the email, addressed as 'Nathan NYSD Chambers', indicating they work in the chambers of a judge in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Copied on the email, identified as a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell in the referenced case.

events.title: Submission of Electronic Devices Application
events.description: Prosecutors submit an electronic devices application form to the court in the case US v. Maxwell, as part of ongoing legal procedures.

keyFacts: The document is an email regarding procedural matters in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It shows coordination between the prosecution and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team (attorneys Everdell, Pagliuca, and Menninger) regarding an electronic devices application.
The email indicates the submission was made electronically, with a question about whether it would need to be formally docketed.
The correspondence is dated November 28, 2021, during the pre-trial or trial phase of Maxwell's prosecution.
